frame.name: Noise_makers
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Noise_maker</fen> is an artifact used to produce sound, especially for musical effect.
<ex>The <fex name="Grnd">church</fex> <t><fex name="nm">bells</fex></t> rang</ex> <ex>The <fex name="Grnd">car</fex> <t><fex name="nm">alarm</fex></t> went off again</ex> <ex>I have never played an <fex name="tp">acoustic</fex> <t><fex name="nm">guitar</fex></t>.</ex> <ex>Each artist personally owns a Steinway and has chosen to perform on the <fex name="Creator">Steinway</fex> <t>piano</t> professionally</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Noise_maker
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the entity or substance that is designed to produce sound.</def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition: <def-root>The use for which an <fen>Noise_maker</fen> is intended.</def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition: <def-root>An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Noise_maker</fen> into existence.</def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which a <fen>Noise_maker</fen> comes into existence.</def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>The term used to refer to an <fen>Noise_maker</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition: <def-root>Any indication of what makes up the <fen>Noise_maker</fen>, including components, etc.</def-root>

FE.name: Ground
FE.definition: <def-root>The location with which the <fen>Noise_maker</fen> is associated.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: guitar.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a stringed musical instrument with a fretted fingerboard and six or twelve strings, played by plucking or strumming with the fingers or a plectrum

lexUnit.name: bell.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a hollow object, typically made of metal and in the shape of a deep inverted cup, that sounds a clear musical note when struck

lexUnit.name: siren.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a device that makes a loud prolonged signal or warning sound

lexUnit.name: piano.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large keyboard musical instrument with a wooden case enclosing a soundboard and metal strings, which are struck by hammers when the keys are depressed.

lexUnit.name: rattle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a thing that makes a rattling sound, in particular a baby's toy consisting of a container filled with small pellets

lexUnit.name: xylophone.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a musical instrument played by striking a row of wooden bars of graduated length with small beaters

lexUnit.name: drum.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a percussion instrument sounded by being struck with sticks or the hands, typically cylindrical, barrel-shaped, or bowl-shaped with a taut membrane over one or both ends.

lexUnit.name: cello.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a bass instrument of the violin family, held upright on the floor between the legs of the seated player.

lexUnit.name: saxophone.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a member of a family of metal wind instruments with a reed like a clarinet, used especially in jazz and dance music

lexUnit.name: alarm.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a warning sound or device.
